notes.note:
Performance enhancements:

 - Quantum CSS improvements which improve page rendering times
 - Faster scrolling due to treating touch event listeners as passive by default

Improved security: On-by-default support for the latest draft of the [TLS 1.3][1] specification


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/Security/Transport_Layer_Security#TLS_1.3
Fixed a recurring crash on Samsung Galaxy S8 devices running Android Oreo (8.0)

system_requirements:
## Operating systems
 - Android 4.1
 - Above versions

## Requirements
 - 50 MB internal storage
 - 384 MB of RAM
 - display at least 320 pixels high and 240 pixels wide
text:
Firefox Quantum keeps on keeping on. Look to this release for even more performance improvements, features that let you do more without leaving the webpage you’re on, and a safer online experience.  

Thank you to all of the [new Mozillians][1] who contributed to this release of Firefox!


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/community/2018/06/18/firefox-61-new-contributors/
title: Firefox for Android 61.0 Release
